Posts.Content: berrygerry wrote: Hi, My daughter had a double mastectomy lasat Nov.  She had breast cancer in the milk duct and a small nodule outside the duct in one breast.  She decided to have both breasts removed.  She was given a 95% cure rate, no chemo and no radiation.  This was confirmed by two different oncs.  She had silicon reconstruction and was up to the nipple part.  Everything was going well then within the last two weeks she had an abnormal Pap smear and burning feeling in her chest.  She did have a slight fever.  She thought it was anxiety attack but her friend told her to go to the ER.  There they did the usual after a CT scan came out and told her that there were 30-40 lesions on her lungs the size of a penny that was consistent with metastasis.  She followed up with her onc and breast surgeon who can not believe the diagnosis since she was so radical with the first diagnosis of breast cancer.  She went for a fine needle biopsy and that was inconclusive.  Today she is going for a biopsy of the lung to see what the lesions are. Has anyone had a similar experience?  She is very young 40. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: mets to lungs??? berrygerry gutsy
